alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 9:42AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack as river flows remain high. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Northside Drive and Southside Drive, which are the main roads in Yosemite Valley, become flooded and are closed to traffic. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Thursday, May 25 the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM PDT Thursday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet Friday, May 26. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 06/18/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this Friday morning at 945 AM PDT.
